eposap:Project.dct:title: EPOS Implementation Phase (EPOS IP)
eposap:Project.dct:description: The nations of Europe are distributed around some of the most complex and dynamic geological systems on the planet and understanding these is essential to the security of livelihoods and economic power of Europeans. Many of the solutions to the grand challenges in the geosciences have been led by European scientists – the understanding of stratigraphy (the timing and distribution of layers of sediment on Earth) and the discovery of the concept of plate tectonics being among the most significant. Our ability to monitor the Earth is rapidly evolving through development of new sensor technology, both on- and below-ground and from outer space; we are able to deliver this information with increasing rapidity, integrate it, provide solutions to geological understanding and furnish essential information for decision makers. Earth science monitoring systems are distributed across Europe and the globe and measure the physico-chemical characteristics of the planet under different geological regimes. EPOS will bring together 24 European nations and combine national Earth science facilities, the associated data and models together with the scientific expertise into one integrated delivery system for the solid Earth. This infrastructure will allow the Earth sciences to achieve a step change in our understanding of the planet; it will enable us to prepare for geo-hazards and to responsibly manage the subsurface for infrastructure development, waste storage and the use of Earth’s resources. With a European Research Infrastructure Consortium (ERIC) to be located in Rome (Italy), EPOS will provide an opportunity for Europe to maintain world-leading European Earth sciences and will represent a model for pan-European federated infrastructure.

eposap:WebService.dct:title: NFOs - Vp/Vs Web Service
eposap:WebService.dct:description: The VpVs (P-wave velocities vs S-wave velocities ratio) Web service allow to retrieve Vp/Vs time series based on P and S arrival times observations generated by quality selected earthquakes within a input defined volume recorded at stations included in the same volume. Service provided by FedeRated specIfic Data GatEway (FRIDGE).
eposap:WebService.dct:license: Creative Commons for data, Open Source licences for software
eposap:WebService.dcat:keyword: Earthquake, Event, rocks, seismic waves propagation, Vp/Vs ratio, VpVs, seismology

eposap:parameter.rdf:label: P-phase onset Hypoinverse standard quality weight
S-phase onset Hypoinverse standard quality weight
Number of P and S couples per earthquake
Degrees of azimuthal stations distribution gap per earthquake
Horizontal distance of the closest station from a earthquake
Maximum allowed formal horizontal error in earthquake location
Maximum allowed formal vertical error in earthquake location

eposap:WebService.dct:title: NFOs - Radon counts and local temperature Web Service
eposap:WebService.dct:description: This service retrieve Radon Gas concentration time series based on periodic counting of Rn gas at site. Service provided by FedeRated specIfic Data GatEway (FRIDGE).
eposap:WebService.dct:license: Creative Commons for data, Open Source licences for software
eposap:WebService.dcat:keyword: Geochemical, Radon concentration, Radon counts, geochemistry, geohazards, long term continuos timeseries, local temperature

eposap:parameter.rdf:label: Minimum "sampling period" allowed to extract data [minutes]
Maximum "sampling period" allowed to extract data [minutes]
maximum % uncertainty of the measure accepted for extraction
maximum distance in time between internal temperature

eposap:WebService.dct:title: NFOs - CO2 Gas soil flux measurements Web Service
eposap:WebService.dct:description: This service retrieve CO2 Gas soil flux and concentration time series based on periodic counting of CO2 gas at site. Service provided by FedeRated specIfic Data GatEway (FRIDGE).
eposap:WebService.dct:license: Creative Commons for data, Open Source licences for software
eposap:WebService.dcat:keyword: Geochemical, CO2 concentration, CO2 flux, geochemistry

eposap:parameter.rdf:label: Minimum "sampling period" allowed to extract data [minutes]
Maximum "sampling period" allowed to extract data [minutes]
Maximum distance in time between internal temperature

eposap:WebService.dct:title: NFOs - Meteorological parameters at CO2 site Web Service
eposap:WebService.dct:description: This service retrieve Meteorological parameters time series based on periodic counting of water level, water conductivity, air temperature, water temperature, rain, humidity, atmospheric pressure at CO2 site. Service provided by FedeRated specIfic Data GatEway (FRIDGE).
eposap:WebService.dct:license: Creative Commons for data, Open Source licences for software
eposap:WebService.dcat:keyword: Geochemical, geochemistry, meteo, meteorological, water level, air temperature, water temperature, water conductivity, rain, humidity, atmospheric pressure
